alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 12:32PM PST until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .The Green Valley Creek remains above flood stage, and is likely to remain in flood through at least Saturday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following county, Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...The Green Valley Creek remains above flood stage, and is likely to remain in flood into Saturday morning. Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1229 PM PST, Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional heavy rain is possible Tuesday. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sebastopol, Forestville and Graton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
